meanings.definition: To expel or discharge contents violently or forcefully.
meanings.sent1: The overflowing sink was disgorging dirty water all over the kitchen floor.
meanings.sent2: The volcano erupted, disgorging hot lava and ash into the sky.
meanings.sent3: The old fountain in the park seemed to be disgorging a never-ending stream of coins.
meanings.sent4: The factory chimney was disgorging thick smoke into the clear blue sky.
meanings.sent5: The burst pipe was disgorging water with such force that it flooded the entire basement.

meanings.definition: To release or pour out something in large quantities.
meanings.sent1: The bakery was disgorging freshly baked bread every morning.
meanings.sent2: The overflowing river was disgorging mud and debris into the valley below.
meanings.sent3: The magician's hat seemed to be disgorging an endless stream of colorful scarves.
meanings.sent4: The treasure chest was disgorging gold coins as the pirates opened it.
meanings.sent5: The storm clouds were disgorging rain, drenching everything in sight.
